name: What build for WOG PW, Aielund?? Please Help. Thanks
author: Asturonethoriusaline

posts.author: Asturonethoriusaline
posts.content:
Hey Hi all, I had at first had NWN, Smart Phone temporarily stop working, lost NWN stuff.

The Good News, Silver lining is that I got my Smart Phone, NWN working again.

And not only that, but I got the PW's back that had once been blue, but had lost access to, been greyed out on PW list, but now got back, working again.

So now I can do Blackstone Keep again, where couldnt for a while.

But not only that. I FINALLY GOT THE WOG PW TO WORK.

I dont know why it didnt work in past, as I installed Cep 2.65, and all the files.

Maybe I accidentally installed a file wrong.

Maybe it's that the WOG Mithral Edition came out(Wasnt available before)

So now I dont have to play in the offline Raine's WOG,1.69 version, solo, offline anymore, as can now play WOG PW ONLINE now.

Also got Aielund to FINALLY work on my Smart Phone.

So now I have the following NWN Mods, PW working on my Smartphone.

WOG PW.

Aielund

Eye of Beholder

Caereen

Lord of Terror

Diablo Remake.

Bard's Tale

Wizardry

Pool of Radiance

Attack on Ruins of Myth Drannor

So that's nice, but what's the point you all are probably wondering.

Well now that I got access to that.

What do any of you think is a good build for those PW's, Mods??

And What how would u build that build??

I am thinking of the following.

Monk 1/6/Druid 21/24/Rogue 13/14(Sneak Attacking Dragon)

Monk 1/6/Druid 18/24/Shifter 14/16/18

Monk 1/6/Cleric 12/19(Str, Mag/Druid 20/22(Insane Buffs, Spells, etc.)

Druid 24/25/Rogue 13/14/SD 2/3/4/5(Epic Dodge)(A Alternative to Max's Druid/Assassin/SD, where replace Assassin with Rogue, allowing to be a Dragon/Transformer/sneaker, HIP's sooner without waiting for cross class. Only thing that give up, is Paralyze, and get Sneak Attack Damage, Epic Dodge, and indispellability)

Monk 9/Druid 26/SD 5(Epic Dodging)

Out of those I think I like the following best.

1. Monk 1/6/Druid 21/24/25/Rogue 13/14 A sneak attacking dragon with Epic Dodge and Monk cheese

2. Druid 24/Rogue 13/SD 3, (A Sneaking attacking Dragon with Epic Dodge, Hips, A Shadow companion, and can do so at a sooner lower level then Max's build. Lose out on Paralyze, but with Low Assassin DC, probably not gona paralyze anyway.)

Which of the either the above options, or which of these 2 options do you think I should go with???

I am really torn between, would like to really do 1 of the 2 builds.

And once the build is chosen, can you all please help me with the build.

Thanks.

And see you all in the WOG PW sometime.

You'll know what to look for.

And the name will probably be something like.

Wiloren Swift Rastirone.

Mike.

posts.author: Asturonethoriusaline
posts.content: Also another consideration, whats best for solo, and whats best for being in a Adventuring party??

posts.author: gkorjax
posts.content:
You're going to be playing World of Greyhawk, the online version, on your cell phone?
Damn...I have a lot of questions....

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
If you are going to be playing on WoG, then you will be spammed with Dispel cheese.

So I suggest Monk 1/6/Druid 21/24/25/Rogue 13/14 A sneak attacking dragon with Epic Dodge and Monk cheese - and make sure the Druid casting levels are 25.

Rogue will tie down your Dex AC, and help against being flatfooted.  UMD will really come in handy here.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: Don't use the same build in every module you play.  That would get monotonous.

Yep a LG K20 Qualcom Snapdragon Android 7 or 8 or 9, 32 gb internal, about 5.85 in screen. 64 gb SD card. NWN, OC, SOU, HOTU, MODS, PW'S all run great.

I tried to put it on the 2016/2017, 10.5 in, Android Tablet I bought, but didnt work on tablet, even tho Icewind Dale, Baldur's Gate 2, Planescape Torment worked 9n the tablet just fine.

Monk/Druid/Rogue

etc

Some somewhat similar builds, with some differences.

Basically if the build can fight in melee, fight ranged, cast spells, sneak attack, epic dodge, good AB/AC, etc, not to watered down, but not too overfocused, etc, then thats what I like.

24 levels of Druid is not enough - BeamDog changed the equation a bit, so now one needs 25 levels.
Even tho, since that's either true or probably true, that need 25 levels to be 100% indispellable.

100% indispellable is OVER FOCUSED.

23/24 Levels of Druid is probably not gona be dispelled, and only dispelled about 1,2,3% of the time, unless at 40th level, and vs a 35 to 40th level dispelling spellcaster/monster BOSS.

Also spell buffing is NOT THE ONLY ONLY thing.

So 24 levels of Druid is probably good enough.

And 24/13/3 fits.

Whereas 25/13/3 does not fit.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
It's not overfocused on WoG.

Trust me on this.

You'll be spammed with dispels.  Especially Greater Dispels (m0bs).  Sometimes Mord's (Boss stuff).

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
I agree with Web regarding dispels on WoG.
You will be spammed with dispels, breaches and Mords.
In a rest restricted environment this is a challenge.
There are a few ways to manage this, here are some I use:
- be undispellable (CL 25 or more) or even better mord resistant (CL 30+, I think CL 27 is enough for Mord scrolls which are CL 17)
- have craft wand or scribe scroll, if you get dispelled simply recast
- bait out dispels with lightly buffed summons, or AOE spells
- kill or disable casters who use dispels asap
- self silence aura (bards and clerics only)
- Invisibility or greater sanctuary to protect your buffs until you can focus down the dispeller
- use undispellable buffs ie EMA, Divine Shield

For a dragon shape build on WoG I highly recommend trying a high caster level druid ie CL 32+ like GDL's World Ender, or my build (CL 36). You get 3x dragon shape uses per day, if you get morded you may have to recast everything including dragon shape, add rest restrictions, I think you get the picture. The high CLs are also not wasted against spell resistant monks or drow.

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content: It's not possible to make a Dragon Shape build with Epic Dodge and Monk levels in vanilla NWN, you need to drop either Dragon Shape, Epic Dodge, or Monk. If WoG has custom subraces that give bonus DEX or WIS then it's possible but I don't think that's the case. You can still go for Rog/Dru/Monk but I'd suggest focusing on WIS and ignoring DEX.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
@conlaoch did a lot of exploring in this thread here RE epic dodge and dragon shape. 
I was his humble assistant

But trying to go between chatting and playing without a keyboard (or rather with the android keyboard covering half the screen) isn't good/convenient/fun/easy.

Performance on my kid's Samsung Tab (10.1", 2GB RAM, 2019 version) is decent too, but not as good as the Snapdragon845 and 6GB of RAM.

- holding the phone to play lots of games (NWN, Stardew Valley, etc) might be giving me tennis elbow

posts.content: I'll add that I solo played the PW Arkhalia on the phone. It was a fun, high magic, 3.5e-ish world. Performance was fine and the experience was great (if someone didn't try to message/talk to me.

posts.author: Asturonethoriusaline
posts.content:
Yunim wrote: ↑
Aug 12, 2020
It's not possible to make a Dragon Shape build with Epic Dodge and Monk levels in vanilla NWN, you need to drop either Dragon Shape, Epic Dodge, or Monk. If WoG has custom subraces that give bonus DEX or WIS then it's possible but I don't think that's the case. You can still go for Rog/Dru/Monk but I'd suggest focusing on WIS and ignoring DEX.
Would you please break down , show why not??

I dont see how taking 1 monk level would prevent epic dodge. Maybe 6 levels of Monk would, but surely not just 1 monk level in the build would prevent epic dodge combined with Dragon Shape

In fact 1 level of Monk would help get Evasion, one of the requirements of Epic Dodge.

Epic Dodge says that need Evasion, Dex 25, 1,2 other class ability/feats, and either 13 levels of Rogue, or 9 monk levels + 5 levels of SD or 10 levels of SD

If I take 1 level of Monk/25 Druid/14 levels of Rogue, And if I start with a 18 dex, 17 Wis.

That leaves me with 10 stat ups(every 4 levels/40 levels) 13 feat slots(every 3 levels/40 levels), (7 of those feats are epic feats that can use to take great dex and great wis), 2,3,4,5,6,7 bonus feats/epic feats, depend on how many epic druid or epic rogue levels that take in epic levels.

Between the stat ups, and great dex, easy to get to 25 dex, AND 30 wisdom. The stat ups alone, 7 dex, 3 wis get u to 25 dex and 20 wis from 18 dex and 17 wis.

Then 7 every 3 level epic feats from l3vels 21 to 40, and 3 to 7 bonus epic feats from epic druid and epic rogue easily give u 10 great Wisdom,more wis increases to wis 30, with 2,3,4 more feats left over 1 of which has to be Dragon Shape, 1 of which is Epic Dodge, then 1,2,3 max for other epic feats like Epic Prowess, Armor Skin, etc.

Its doable, its tight, not much room for error, but its doable.

And I dont see how 6 monk levels, let alone only 1 monk level would stop that.

But maybe I'm wrong.

So maybe you can break it down, show me??

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content: An elf or halfling can start with either 19DEX/18WIS or 20DEX/17WIS. To end with 25DEX/30WIS you need a minimum of 18 ability increases, which requires 8 epic feats (G DEX / G WIS). On top of that you then need Dragon Shape and Epic Dodge for a total of 10 epic feats. There is no possible combination of Dru/Monk/Rog or Dru/Monk/SD that can manage that in vanilla NWN. Dru20/Monk1/SD19 can get 10 epic feats but since G DEX isn't an SD bonus feat it still can't qualify for both Dragon Shape and Epic Dodge.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
Ummm...some bosses on WoG have vanilla TS (and some m0bs have creature abilities that allow them to "notice" a sneaker).

Not meaning one cannot sneak, but it is not a "get out of danger free" card.  So that should be said.

Many areas have undead/elementals/golem types, which are immune to SA.

Many m0bs hit very hard - enough so that it can penetrate the +6/40 DR.

Zen Archery is a great feat to use for a Wis based character.

You may find levelling any version of your character very difficult, especially in Epic levels.

What do you recommend???

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Asturonethoriusaline wrote: ↑
Aug 12, 2020

Well if I am going to go with a non dex, wisdom focused build, then that means the best I can do is:

Monk 6/Druid 25/Rogue 9 or Monk 1/Druid 25/Rogue 14 builds with dragon shape, no epic dodge, and with sneak attack, with higher AC, no Hips. Zen Archery nice, but not as needed, wanted

Or

Druid 25/Rogue 13/SD 2 or Druid 25/Rog 12/SD 3, Dragon, Sneak Attacking, Hips, no higher AC of monk, definately going to have to have, need, want Zen Archery.

So I will use these builds in general.

But for WOG, which build should I use, and tips???

Thanks
Builds if you want dragon shape:

Maximillan Kane's Champion of the Wilderness
Grizzled_Dwarflord's The World Ender
Orion's The Skilled and Sneaky Arch-Druid

These are all written by WoG players so you won't go wrong with any of em.
I played my build to level 40 for example. I didn't need any powerful items. Just a thieves's hood, a few wisdom boosts on rings, and a little strength to carry equipment and I was good to play.
You will notice the lowest Druid levels in these builds is 28 on Max's -> undispellability (and caster levels) is highly valued.
Don't play a dragon build without Monk in it in an unfamiliar environment, if you are still learning. 

Tips - druid summons are empowered on WoG similar to cleric animal domain. Use em until you have Druid 7/Monk 1 for Bear Form and Stone Skin, then start fighting as a Monk Bear. Just put all your spells as summon creatures. Use the book of summons to change your Summon II creature (summon I spell) to Brown Bear. Let the bear kill stuff so you are not put in danger, until you are stronger. The first few levels a critical hit or two probably will kill you so don't get mobbed. Annoy a monster with a sling and pull em away from his friends to defeat em rather than charge in. Also don't be afraid to die. Just focus on improving and you will find things get easier, because your skills as a player improve.


Web is correct in fact I would rephrase - a lot of important bosses have true sight or sneak immunity. Just focus on building a strong druid with dragon shape, with a little monk and something else you like.
Don't chase HiPS in a dragon shape build, do that when you are more experienced.

Don't be discouraged. But my advice is don't start with unusual builds in WoG like epic dodging dragon shape druids especially if you are playing from a smart phone and playing solo. 

Start with something you know is strong, then reconsider where to go from there. The unusual builds can wait until you are better as a player, it will happen if you stick with it. You will have more fun and less problems. Once you are more familiar with the environment then you can play less powerful builds.

posts.author: Asturonethoriusaline

So time to solve for Druid 25/X level, X class/ X lev, X class, where solving for X, where X is the class and levels that take in addition to Druid.

If thats even possible, according to what Web saying.

I think Monk has to be one of the classes, or if not Monk, then something really good like Cleric, etc.

Monk 1/Druid 25/Cleric 14, problem with that is Cleric is dispellable.

And Jorg by Valefor has done similar to Monk 1/Cleric 19/Druid 20, problem with that is both Druid, Cleric Dispellable

So Monk 1/6/Druid 24/25/X Class, X lev, solve for X

Or

Cleric X Lev/Druid 25/X Class, X Lev

Solve for X class, X level

Solve for X

I dont want to do Monk 1,6/Druid 24/25/Drifter 10/14, as I have done that, even tho that was extremely good on WOG.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
I still don't understand why you are so keen on stopping at Druid 25. What is wrong with any of three builds I suggested?
More levels of Druid means you get bonus feats, your spells penetrate more often and you get dragon shape earlier, and your spells are resistant to Mords which as a Druid you don't have a lot of good ways to prevent spellcasters casting on you.
You might be a dragon, but all your buffs will be stripped bare by this spell and the enemies will kill you, or you will be very annoyed because you have to unshift to recast your buffs. There are a lot of spell resistant enemies in some areas such as Drow, Demonweb Pits and there is a Monk area in the desert too. If you are wandering around in the Underdark facing off against a bunch of Drow Wizards its not going to be fun if you go light on caster levels. Also don't discount rogue. I played a Druid / Monk / Rogue to level 40. UMD is very useful.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
I have done many Dragon builds on WoG (and leveled them to 40).

Two stand out - The World Ender by Grizzled Dwarflord (though I went with Rog) and Puff the Mighty Dragon v3.0 (with custom building added from me).

The only thing "missing" is immunity to Death magic. Since there are Sorcs who spam Dispel and then Finger of Death, you WILL roll a 1 and die.

Especially around 40 or 50 attempts.

5 or 6 a round (from multiple sources).

The Dispel/Breach knocks off everything in a Timestop flurry (so you can do nothing) then comes the spam.

However, there are areas where this is not the norm - and DS does fine.

Case in point - Puff. Is very vulnerable to Dispel. But where that is not present, it is THE mightiest dragon of all.

Sent from my SM-G955F using Tapatalk

posts.author: Asturonethoriusaline
posts.content:
Orion wrote: ↑
Aug 13, 2020
I still don't understand why you are so keen on stopping at Druid 25. What is wrong with any of three builds I suggested?
More levels of Druid means you get bonus feats, your spells penetrate more often and you get dragon shape earlier, and your spells are resistant to Mords which as a Druid you don't have a lot of good ways to prevent spellcasters casting on you.
You might be a dragon, but all your buffs will be stripped bare by this spell and the enemies will kill you, or you will be very annoyed because you have to unshift to recast your buffs. There are a lot of spell resistant enemies in some areas such as Drow, Demonweb Pits and there is a Monk area in the desert too. If you are wandering around in the Underdark facing off against a bunch of Drow Wizards its not going to be fun if you go light on caster levels. Also don't discount rogue. I played a Druid / Monk / Rogue to level 40. UMD is very useful.
Thanks for everything what you have said in this thread.

Why Druid 25?

1. Because that's the MINIMUM Druid level for INDISPELLABILITY except for Mords.

2. In a 3 class level split, there is Usually not enough levels for 1 of the 2 other classes.

If I want to go Monk 6(say for IKD), an or 7,8,9 Rogue levels(enough for decent skills, Sneak Attack, Uncanny Dodge, etc, then 25,26,27 Druid levels is most can take.

Or

If I want Monk 1/Cleric 14/Druid 25, I cant take more then 25,26,27 Druid levels, because If I do, then its pointless to go with less then 12,13,14 cleric levels, and only taking 11 cleric levels. If have to take 28+ levels of Druid, then might as well scrap the build at that point, because not enough cleric levels for the build to work.

Or

If I go with:

Monk 1/Druid 25/Shifter 14, if I have 27,28,29+ druid levels, I wont be able to take the minimum of about 12,13,14 shifter levels to work.

Its a matter of fit, and what want to do. If want to go with 28/30/32/34 Druid levels, your better off with either 2 classes, or Monk 6/Druid 32/SD 2, or a Monk 6/Druid 34.

With the Druid/Monk/Rogue build I might be able to go with either Monk 1/Druid 29/30/Rogue 9/10 or Monk 6/Druid 28/Rog 6, but prob is either I wouldnt get Monk IKD helping feat progession, selection, an or wouldnt maybe not get high enough Rogue levels. Monk 6/Druid 25/Rog 9 gets me Monk IKD, indispellable druid, except Mords, and high enough Rogue levels.

If u have a way for me to get high enough monk levels, high enough cleric levels, high enough rogue levels, while still having 28,30,32,34, etc, druid levels, I am definately all ears for that.


You said that the Summon Book in WOG beefs up summons, like Cleric Animal Domain.(I already knew that from my Monk/Druid/Shifter.

If I take Cleric Animal Domain, does that STACK with the Summon Book in WOG??

Would my Druid get to have his level 1 summons bumped up to level 3, with +1 summon level(Book), an another + 1 summon level(Cleric Animal Domain), and his Level 2 Summons bumped up to level 4??

If the answer is yes, then its most definately worth playing a:

Monk 1/Cleric 14/Druid 25, with Animal, Str, Magic, as 3 Domains.

Only problem with that is Cleric Spells dispellable, but that is offset by the higher summoning levels, Cleric Cheese.

Also I got my Monk 6/Druid 18/Shifter to get its Dragon at level 30, so dont have to use only epic druid level bonus epic feats, as can use epic Rog, epic Shifter, Epic Cleric feats, to still bevable to take Dragon at level 30 to level 33.

Going by what u have said so far

Then I am thinking of

Monk 1/6/Druid 25/27/30/33/Rog 6/9

Or

Monk 1/Druid 25/26/Shifter 13/14(Shifter gets important epic bonus feat at either 13,14 level

Or

Monk 1/Cleric 13/14/Druid 25/26

Or

Monk 6/Ranger 9/Druid 25

LOTS OF ATTACKS PER ROUND

If u have explanations, breakdowns of better builds that can give me high enough levels of Monk, or Cleric, or Rogue, in addition to 27+ Druid levels, instead of only 25 indispellable except by Mords, levels, then I am definately all ears for that.

Thanks for your interesting, helpful post.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
The Book of Summons on WoG does NOT increase the Caster level Summons to X. 

Instead, it allows one to "fix" the creature that one summons with the Summons spell.  Since the possible creatures for each summons level are varied, it is very powerful - one merely selects a creature that does well vs expected enemies.

Animal Domain (Cleric, Druid) increases the Caster level Summons up to X (Elemental Princes).  Though powerful in their own right, most Epic (and in some cases, pre-Epic) m0bs will make quick work of them.  Even buffed.  Major Bosses will just run right through them.

As for Dragon builds, I would suggest World Ender by GDL.  Just exchange 2 of the Fighter levels and 1 Druid for Rog (that picks up Uncanny Dodge and gets UMD). Druid31/Rog3/Monk6. Then you have a nice, powerful Dragon that has a solid Dex AC (even when flatfooted) and it can UMD (and use a Thieves Hood for protection vs KD, which can be a problem as some major bosses will spam IKD when they need a 20 to hit).

posts.author: Asturonethoriusaline
posts.content:
For Orion:

I have studied the Druid, Cleric, Rogue entries in the NWN wiki

According to that:

The opt splits for, are:

Monk/Druid/Rogue:

Monk 6(For IKD)

Druid 27/28: For Infinite Elementals, or Druid Epic Bonus Feat

Rogue 6/7: 3d6, or4d6 Sneak Attack, Uncanny Dodge 2


Monk/Druid/Shifter:

Monk 1: Monk Cheese

Druid 26: Indispellability, infinite Elementals.

Shifter: 13: 1 Epic Bonus feat, and can use Epic Basilisk, etc.

Monk/Cleric/Druid

Monk 1: Monk Cheese

Druid 26:Infinite Elementals, indispellability(Except Mords)

Cleric 13: Epic Feats every 3 epic levels that take epic cleric level, 7th level cleric spells

This probably might probably be about the best that can be done, and highest Druid level that can, would, should be done, about pretty close to alnost being the most opt for these builds, according to what the NWN wiki say what, which gets what, and according to what want to do.

These are the main 3 builds that I am going to do for WOG and other Mods, PW's.

I am open to very slight tweaks on level splits, and very open to, would love tips within these class, level split shells,builds, on what to take at each level, class, feat, stat up, skills, etc, wise.

This is based on input from Orion, Valefor, Mik Dagger, Web Shaman, and the links provided by them to various builds.

The Druid/Monk/Rogue builds, that Orion, others have posted, and Valefor's Jorg(Monk/Cleric/Druid) build have been helpful.

This is also based on the NWN Wiki

Thanks you guys.

Mike.

posts.author: Asturonethoriusaline
posts.content:
webshaman1 wrote: ↑
Aug 13, 2020
The Book of Summons on WoG does NOT increase the Caster level Summons to X. 

Instead, it allows one to "fix" the creature that one summons with the Summons spell.  Since the possible creatures for each summons level are varied, it is very powerful - one merely selects a creature that does well vs expected enemies.

Animal Domain (Cleric, Druid) increases the Caster level Summons up to X (Elemental Princes).  Though powerful in their own right, most Epic (and in some cases, pre-Epic) m0bs will make quick work of them.  Even buffed.  Major Bosses will just run right through them.

As for Dragon builds, I would suggest World Ender by GDL.  Just exchange 2 of the Fighter levels and 1 Druid for Rog (that picks up Uncanny Dodge and gets UMD). Druid31/Rog3/Monk6. Then you have a nice, powerful Dragon that has a solid Dex AC (even when flatfooted) and it can UMD (and use a Thieves Hood for protection vs KD, which can be a problem as some major bosses will spam IKD when they need a 20 to hit).
The ONLY potential thing I dont like about this split, is that ONLY 3 levels of rogue only has 2d6 sneak attack.

If go with

Druid 27/28(Infinite Elementals, indispellable except Mords, and a druid Epic Bonus feat at Druid level 28

Monk 6: IKD

Rogue: 6/7: Get 3 d6 sneak attack, Uncanny Dodge 2, for level 6 Rogue(Can take Druid 28 if do that), or get 4d6 sneak attack damage, better skills, uncanny dodge 2 for level 7 rogue(but wont get Druid 28, and get Druid 27 instead.

This gives up to 2 d6 sneak attack improvement, over the 2d6 sneak attack for level 3 rogue, uncanny dodge 2, and better skills.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Thanks for explaining Asturonethoriusaline, it is important to ensure to play what you find most fun for you and I do like a lot of sneak attack damage, it is a trade off with spellcasting. I do like Web's idea for a slightly modified World Ender allowing it UMD and uncanny dodge.
Hope our comments have been helpful and thought provoking
WoG can be a tough place to play solo but I am sure myself and Web simply want you to have a good time and crush those enemies!

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content: I see no real problem with going more Rogue and less Druid, personally.
